comments:
I get the following exception when I try to run ANT for a build file.

XML parser factory has not been configured correctly: Provider for 
javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory cannot be found
	at org.apache.tools.ant.util.JAXPUtils.newParserFactory
(JAXPUtils.java:114)

(JAXPUtils.java:99)

Build exception: XML parser factory has not been configured correctly: 
Provider for javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory cannot be found



THE Build.xml FILE:

<?xml version="1.0"?>

<!-- ======================================================================= --
>
<!-- Build file                                                              --
>
<!-- ======================================================================= --
>
<project name="reporting" default="deploy" basedir=".">

  <!-- Specify the ant properties file for this application -->
  <property file="${user.home}/jpcm-build.properties"/>

  <property name="src.dir"     value="${basedir}"/>
  <property name="ext.lib.dir" value="${root.dir}/${external.dir}"/>
  <property name="tmp.dir"     value="${root.dir}/temp"/>
  <property name="tmp.ejb.dir" value="${tmp.dir}/EJB/${ant.project.name}"/>
  <property name="tmp.lib.dir" value="${tmp.dir}/prebuild/lib"/>
  <property name="tmp.classes.dir" value="${tmp.dir}/prebuild/classes"/>
  <property name="ear.dir"     value="${root.dir}/${application.name}.ear"/>
  <property name="war.lib.dir" value="${ear.dir}/${application.name}.war/WEB-
INF/lib"/>
  <property name="jar.filepath" 
value="${tmp.ejb.dir}/jpcm_09_${ant.project.name}.jar"/>

<!-- ======================================================================= --
>
<!-- Check environment                                                       --
>
<!-- ======================================================================= --
>
  <path id="xdoclet.path">
     <pathelement location="${ant.home}/lib/ant.jar" />
     <pathelement location="${xdoclet.home}/lib/xdoclet.jar" />
     <fileset dir="${log4j.home}/dist/lib">
       <include name="**/log4j*.jar"/>
    </fileset>

  </path>

  <path id="base.path">
    <path refid="xdoclet.path"/>

    <!-- Include the J2EE library -->
    <pathelement location="${j2ee.home}/lib/j2ee.jar" />

    <!-- Include the JAR files of external libraries like xml parsers and so 
on -->
    <fileset dir="${ext.lib.dir}">
      <include name="**/*.jar"/>
      <include name="**/*.zip"/>
    </fileset>

    <!-- Include the JAR files needed for resolving dependencies -->
    <fileset dir="${tmp.lib.dir}">
      <include name="**/*.jar"/>
    </fileset>

    <!-- Special because we have a circular dependency between Article and 
Classification -->
    <pathelement location="${tmp.classes.dir}" />
  </path>

  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <!-- Generates the necessary directory structure                         -->
  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <target name="prepare">
    <echo level="verbose" 
message="*****************************************************"/>
    <echo level="verbose" message=" BUILD ${ant.project.name}"/>
    <echo level="verbose" 
message="*****************************************************"/>
    <mkdir dir="${tmp.ejb.dir}" />
    <mkdir dir="${tmp.lib.dir}" />
    <mkdir dir="${war.lib.dir}" />
    <!-- ensure framework part is up-to-date -->
    <ant antfile="${root.dir}/src/EJB/Framework/build.xml" inheritAll="false"/>
  </target>

  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <!-- Check if we need to call the xDoclet target                         -->
  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <target name="checkbeandate" depends="prepare">
    <condition property="interfaces.uptodate">
      <uptodate>
        <srcfiles dir="${src.dir}"/>
        <mapper type="regexp" from="^(.*)Bean.java$$" to="${tmp.ejb.dir}/
\1Home.java"/>
      </uptodate>
    </condition>
  </target>

  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <!-- Generates the necessary EJB classes and deployment descriptors      -->
  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <target name="xdoclet" depends="checkbeandate" unless="interfaces.uptodate">
     <taskdef name="ejbdoclet" classname="xdoclet.ejb.EjbDocletTask">
        <classpath refid="xdoclet.path"/>
     </taskdef>

     <ejbdoclet
        sourcepath="${src.dir}"
        destdir="${tmp.ejb.dir}"
        classpathref="base.path"
        excludedtags="@version,@author"
        ejbspec="${ejb.version}"
        force="${xdoclet.force}"
      >
        <fileset dir="${src.dir}">
           <include name="**/*Bean.java"/>
        </fileset>

        <remoteinterface/>
        <homeinterface/>
        <utilobject
          templatefile="${root.dir}/src/EJB/Loader.j"
          pattern="{0}Loader"/>
        <deploymentdescriptor destdir="${tmp.ejb.dir}/META-INF"/>
        <!-- AS 4/29/02 Do not validate XML files because JBoss 3.0 message 
driven will
             report an wrong error because it uses the wrong jboss.dtd -->
        <jboss version="${jboss.version}"
           xmlencoding="UTF-8"
           destdir="${tmp.ejb.dir}/META-INF"
           validateXml="false"
        />
     </ejbdoclet>
  </target>

  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <!-- Compiles the source code                                            -->
  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <target name="compile" depends="xdoclet">
     <javac
        destdir="${tmp.ejb.dir}"
        debug="on"
        deprecation="off"
        optimize="on"
        classpathref="base.path"
        includes="**/*.java"
     >
        <src path="${src.dir}"/>
        <src path="${tmp.ejb.dir}"/>
     </javac>
  </target>

  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <!-- Deletes the jar archive                                             -->
  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <target name="delete jar" depends="compile" if="deletejarfiles.flag">
      <delete verbose="false">
       <fileset dir="${tmp.ejb.dir}">
         <include name="**/*.jar"/>
       </fileset>
    </delete>
  </target>

  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <!-- Creates the jar archive                                             -->
  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <target name="create jar" depends="delete jar">
     <jar destfile="${jar.filepath}" update="yes">
       <fileset dir="${tmp.ejb.dir}" casesensitive="yes" >
         <include name="**/*.class"/>
         <include name="**/*.xml"/>
       </fileset>
    </jar>
  </target>

  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <!-- Copy the JAR File                                                   -->
  <!-- =================================================================== -->
  <target name="deploy" depends="create jar">
    <copy file="${jar.filepath}" todir="${tmp.lib.dir}" 
preservelastmodified="true"/>
    <copy file="${jar.filepath}" todir="${ear.dir}" 
preservelastmodified="true"/>
    <property name="${ant.project.name}.built" value="true"/>
  </target>

</project>

Was this using the default Ant classpath or have you modified to use Ant 1.5.1?
What is on your Ant classpath?
Appears to be a duplicate of bug 23239.

Seems you are right, 
i changed the classpath settings for the ant libraries, because
our build files are not compatible to ant 1.4.1.
Classpath in eclipse: 
Ant_Home/ant.jar
Ant_Home/jakarta-regexp-1.2.jar
Ant_Home/optional.jar
Ant_Home/xercesImpl.jar
Ant_Home/xml-apis.jar


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 23239 ***
